Package warzone.state

Class MapEditor

java.lang.Object
warzone.state.Phase
warzone.state.MapEditor
public class MapEditor
extends Phase
ConcreteState of the State pattern. In this example, defines behavior for commands that are valid in this state, and for the others signifies that the command is invalid.

    • saveMap

      public boolean saveMap​(java.lang.String p_fileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Performs the action for the user command: savemap filename Save a map to a text file exactly as edited (using the "domination" game map format).
      Specified by:
      saveMap in class Phase
      Parameters:
      p_fileName - the filename
      Returns:
      true if successfully save the map, otherwise return false
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - the exception of saving files

    • editMap

      public boolean editMap​(java.lang.String p_fileName)
      Performs the action for the user command: editmap filename Load a map from an existing "domination" map file, or create a new map from scratch if the file does not exist
      Specified by:
      editMap in class Phase
      Parameters:
      p_fileName - the filename
      Returns:
      true if successfully edit the map, otherwise return false

    • validateMap

      public boolean validateMap()
      Performs the action for the user command: validatemap Verification of map correctness. The map should be automatically validated upon loading and before saving (at least 3 types of incorrect maps). The validatemap command can be triggered any time during map editing.
      Specified by:
      validateMap in class Phase
      Returns:
      true if it is a valid map, otherwise return false
